title: "Magnetic Healing: Mesmer's Propositions and Ancient Opinions"
first_phrase: In the preceding tokens, Mesmer discusses the properties of magnetic energy and how it affects living beings. He points out that there are some rare organisms whose presence alone can nullify any magnetic effects on nearby objects. In this final part, Mesmer draws comparisons between the principles of his own theory and those of ancient medicine, specifically regarding the use of magnets in healing practices. He explains how his own method can cure diseases of the nerves and offers a new theory of illness in which his opposing principle plays a vital role. With his "new theory," Mesmer believes he can demonstrate the universal usefulness of his method.

last_phrase: In conclusion, this doctrine on the use of magnetic principles in medicine promises to bring about a new understanding of diseases and their treatment.
